meanings.definition: A large, modern movie theater complex with multiple screens.
meanings.sent1: We went to the megaplex to watch the latest superhero movie.
meanings.sent2: The megaplex in the city center always shows the newest releases.
meanings.sent3: At the megaplex, I accidentally walked into the wrong theater and ended up watching a comedy instead of a thriller.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a megaplex, with thoughts and ideas playing on multiple screens at once.
meanings.sent5: The megaplex was so huge that it felt like stepping into a different world altogether.

meanings.definition: A large, complex structure or building.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle was a megaplex of towers, walls, and secret passages.
meanings.sent2: The industrial park featured a megaplex of warehouses and factories.
meanings.sent3: The megaplex of highways and roads in the city made it easy to get lost.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were a megaplex of joy, sadness, and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The megaplex of information in the library was overwhelming but exciting.
